Posts.Content: On 10/11/2009 will be ok2 wrote: Hi there - I am a veteran on this site for the last year and have gotten some great advice from you guys and gals.  Usual rundown...I am now 36, had a double mastectomy with immediate recon a year ago.  Permanent implants (silicone) are in.  I have been procrastinating on whether or not to get the nipple procedure done.  Should I get the procedure done or just get the tatooing from a tatoo artist?  I have heard some stories about the nipples becoming necrotic and falling off.  Or they completely flatten out, in some women relatively quickly, and become unnoticable anyway.  I am more concerned about them falling off and making me more disfigured.  The scars are bad enough.  Don't get me wrong...I do appreciate that these things can be done in this day and age but I am always that one percent that gets the wierd things going wrong.  One expander was popped with the injection needle in the middle of my chemo treatments and I needed to have it replaced...DURING CHEMO.  Now I have a hernia in the right implant since the day it was put in and need another operation to place mesh under the implant to hold the implant in place and get rid of the bulge that is now there underneath.  Has anyone out there had the nipple procedure done and have pros or cons to share with me so I can have more piece of mind to make my decision???    Thanks! Hi! I had a bilateral mastectomy with a tram reconstruction (breasts recon with body fat from abdomen) 9 yrs ago.  I also had the nipple reconstruction & I am very pleased with the results.  The nipple is slightly raised and looks as natural as it can be under the circumstances.  I then had the tatooing for the color.  The tatooing will fade over time which mine has but I chose not to have it redone.  It just is not that important to me anymore.  After 9 yrs I still have all the scars from the mastectomy and reconstruction, but they have faded over the yrs.  If I had to do it all over again, I would make the same choices.  I am currently 58 yrs. old.  I hope this has helped.
Posts.Title: Nipple reconstruction...to do..or not to do???
